programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to north Texas to enter the bidding at the biggest storage auction in America, where more than 800 containers are up for grabs.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones stumble across a collection of valuable saddles in an unlikely location, and examine the contents of a military storage box.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit state capital Austin, where Moe and Mary compete for a locker worth $8,000

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba demonstrate they have a mean side as tensions rise during the last day of auctions in Austin.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a 1950s table hockey game while the team work on a slot machine that rewards winners with cigars instead of money.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a piece of playground equipment from a 1970s McDonald's and a portable record player.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The temperature rises, sending the alligators into a frenzy. Liz hopes to have a full boat by midday, while Junior Edwards aims to bring home a record-breaking haul.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman enjoys the festivities at a carnival in Kentucky, but when venomous snakes infest the fairground, he is faced with the challenge of clearing them all out.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Kentucky pest-controller Ernie Brown Jr returns to eliminate more animal invaders. He must capture an escaped llama, which he has never encountered before, and heads to a community pool to rid it of some unwanted visitors.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out a Japanese animatronic monkey and wonders whether it is worth his time and effort.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1906 silver half dollar that belonged to a passenger on the Titanic is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A couple try to exchange a pair of earrings for a promise ring, but Les declares the stones purchased for $1,000 as fake.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth intervenes in a confrontation between a customer and an employee in the car park, and is later given a 30th birthday surprise by his colleagues.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts explore the controversy surrounding the ancient Crystal Skulls, asking what powers might be unleashed if all 13 artefacts were brought together.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: From Portuguese towns to villages in Romania, mysterious flying objects are appearing over Europe, baffling witnesses and leaving unanswered questions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny acquires inside information on a prized locker - and when she opens it, she discovers it contains information on a centuries-old secret society.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor makes a find that leads him to a basketball arena, while another bidder is not so successful and left desperate for revenge.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A family feud leads to Ashley's resignation. Meanwhile, a couple of women try to sell a dirty fur coat and a man offers to pawn his gold tooth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les misses Ashley's presence in the shop, while a man employs menacing tactics to persuade the dealers to buy a couple of outdated computer monitors.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1769 set of playing cards with hidden political message shuffles into the shop. Also, Corey checks out a set of Charlie's Angels figurines.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the gang encounter seeds that were sent into space, a spaceship toilet seat and a photo autographed by famous astronauts.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones get off to a slow start at a storage auction in Los Angeles, but their fortunes improve when they find a digger, forklift truck tyres and welding equipment.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones score a 1970s skateboard and a bullet-proof vest at an auction in Long Beach, California.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny buys a storage unit that contains a locked safe - but she has no idea how to open it or what might be inside.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That)
programme.desc: Jenny restores some old furniture, while tensions erupt between her, Lesa and Mary.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at whether malfunctioning elevators, hydraulics problems or pilot fatigue caused the deaths of 217 people in a catastrophic air crash.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange objects above Sweden, a UFO over Portugal and an extraordinary mass-sighting of strange luminous phenomena in a remote Italian village.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into the power of the number three in history, science and astronomy, and its possible links to extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The retailers scrutinise a signature apparently made by deposed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein, and Les loses his cool with a customer over a broken necklace. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les attends a business meeting, and as soon as he has gone Ashley tries to undermine Seth. A vicious standoff results after the vendors fail to agree a price of some jewellery. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man tries to sell a series of poorly stuffed animals, leading to to an unusual threat being made against Les.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones are in Hollywood, where despite stiff competition they hope to lay claim to film memorabilia, including an autographed Raging Bull poster.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1970s mechanical bull and a banjo from the 1940s.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Dublin dealer Ian Dowling and his mate Butzy search for treasures in Cork. Items include a mysterious stone head and a carving of a famous figure from Irish mythology.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Bazillionaire?
programme.desc: Don and the guys are in an industrial area of Toronto for an auction, and Roy hopes there will be some hidden treasures in the industrial lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Father-and-son team Bogart and Paul argue over Paul's propensity to spend, while janitors Mike and Armando make an appearance at the auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey return to the auctions only to be greeted by fierce competition. Dave finds a piece of board game history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Comedians Matt Forde and Jessica Knappett play a series of video games, including The Sims, Need For Speed, Headmaster VR and Jurassic Lark.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The comedians are challenged to taste-test some mystery baby food, Russell Howard presents a nightmarish fairy tale and Liza Tarbuck introduces a plastic lizard to a cordless drill.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended version of a 2007 edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, presented by Kirsty Young. Former Labour politician Bob Marshall-Andrews and Dr Phil Hammond join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Bill Bailey, Rich Hall, Rob Brydon and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions on the topic of holidays, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon sees a fast-track management scheme as a way to escape portering. Frankie - who is fired - and Tillman - who is tasered - are miffed.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: The team heads up the Murray River in Victoria to meet Mingo, a collector who specialises in FJ Holdens and vintage Indian and Harley Davidson motorcycles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys get the pick of a lifetime at a famous tourist attraction, plus a collector in Cape Cod shuts down a deal until his wife steps in.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse forges controversial alliances, while Sean uncovers an auction lot that has been used for a prank.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori discover a flamethrower in a storage unit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In the heartland of beer, Frank is surprised to meet an old friend, and the guys secretly prepare a surprise build for Danielle.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys double-team a packed property to find what they are looking for before nightfall, and Mike discovers something living in the attic.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat creates a cosy cabin in Germany, Peter and Bryan Sr win a Guinness World Record with their log car, and Joel takes on a difficult build.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A Second World War anti-aircraft gun must be deconstructed on the island of Hoy, and a new concept in floating homes is sent hundreds of miles to York.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi embarks on a complete redesign of Cheshire Constabulary's fleet of outdated forensic vans and a crime car comes in with a faulty wailer - but the fault remains elusive.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: This time, Russell Howard gets some new tattoos, Tim Vine strips to his waist, and Alice Levine clumsily copies the work of Leonardo da Vinci using squirty cream.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace, sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedienne Sarah Millican join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to banish their pet hates - which include people at cashpoints, barbecues, shop assistants, buffets and anti-social cats - to the infamous room.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes TV presenter Fern Britton, comic actor Robert Webb and broadcaster Danny Baker to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: University Challenge host Jeremy Paxman takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2018, with BBC Breakfast business presenter Steph McGovern and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2010 Christmas special of the comedy quiz, with boy wizard Harry Potter - better known to his mum as actor Daniel Radcliffe - chat show supremo Graham Norton, comedian Lee Mack and regular Alan Davies answering questions on the theme of hocus pocus. Stephen Fry is the man in the middle.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: The couple are thrilled when they are finally invited to Jonathan Ross's Halloween party, where Lucy is very excited to meet Jason Donovan.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Robert Webb, Phill Jupitus, Ronni Ancona and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions about hypnosis, hallucinations and hysteria, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Milton Jones, Miles Jupp and Andi Osho join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a 2011 round of the satirical news quiz.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day explores the case of Edith Thompson, who conspired with her lover to murder her husband in 1922 - a story that inspired Alfred Hitchcock.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The German police's attempts to catch a depraved and psychotic killer, who struck fear into women travelling on Berlin's S-Bahn train network during the Second World War.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, trainee Claire Oates takes her driving test, while chef Alex and manager Michelle prepare a dinner for 130 people on the East Lancashire railway.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Who Put Bella in the Wych Elm
programme.desc: The dark tale of the skeleton of an unknown woman found in a hollowed-out tree in Birmingham woodland, exploring the links between the woman and Nazi spy rings operating in Britain.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A team of engineers fight to return a veteran Westland Wessex helicopter to the skies - 30 years after its last flight.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team heads back to Alice Taylor-Garret's home armed with more questions, only to find it is too late. Grace and Mel uncover evidence suggesting Gerald Doyle may have been a government mole, and could have been involved in the murder - but just when it seems they are getting somewhere, the investigation takes an explosive turn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Neil is hauled into custody on a murder charge, mutual mistrust begins to brew between the Sun Hill regulars and the National Crime Squad team led by Mickey Webb. Ever resourceful, Neil pretends to have hard evidence that a corrupt copper is responsible for his predicament - deliberately provoking an attempt on his own life as a way of proving his innocence.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: As Blue Watch are putting out a small fire, young joyriders chased by the police crash into a tanker and cause a huge blaze at a petrol station.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe competes in a boxing match, with the odds favouring him to win. Meanwhile, Collette sets her heart on a wedding Jo cannot afford.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B Company are on exercise in the Northern Territory of Australia, and their skills are put to the test during a trip in the outback.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Neil is hauled into custody on a murder charge, mutual mistrust begins to brew between the Sun Hill regulars and the National Crime Squad team led by Mickey Webb. Ever resourceful, Neil pretends to have hard evidence that a corrupt copper is responsible for his predicament - deliberately provoking an attempt on his own life as a way of proving his innocence.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola's daughter Cleo borrows the car against her mother's wishes, and is later rushed to hospital after being involved in a crash. Diane urges Dean to be realistic about his limitations as a surgeon. However, this makes him more determined than ever to prove his worth - to the point of diagnosing patients unsupervised and administering unauthorised treatments.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark is suspected of stealing drugs from the department, pressure mounts on Penny, and Sam gets a shock while prying into Lee's private life. Meanwhile, Tina surprises herself by asking Sean for a date. Starring Paterson Joseph and Jonathan Kerrigan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde keeps getting himself into trouble, while Frank continues to try to win Pat over.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The locals are attending a football match and Arthur comes close to having his secret relationship with Mrs Hewitt found out by Pauline.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote performs a heroic rescue for a mother and baby trapped in an attic flat. Meanwhile, Recall returns to duty now that Jamie is getting better.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: The sale of Glenbogle's biggest mountain for a development of holiday cottages causes a major rift between Stella and Archie, but the most sinister threat comes in the form of entrepreneur Stuart McIntosh who has his eye on both the land and Lexie. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is drawn into a serious family dispute by an American woman who believes her father murdered her mother and wants him deported back to Florida to stand trial. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack inherits his deceased employer's bad-tempered dog. Billy, meanwhile, is keen to discover if blondes do have more fun.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: With no sign of Jeffrey Fairbrother, Ted is summoned to Head Office, and jumps to the conclusion that he is about to be made entertainments manager. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy's policeman boyfriend calls at the house with important news and Alistair suddenly realises he wants to settle down, but he can't decide what should come first - work or romance. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Romance Springs a Leak
programme.desc: When Hobbo learns that Howard feels he is taken for granted by Pearl and that Toby misses his former wife, he hatches a plan to sort out their love lives - with the help of flowers, a Mario Lanza recording and his own team of miming violinists.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Havers returns to work and is forced to confront demons from her past as the team investigates the case of a woman murdered with a shotgun. A cryptic word painted at the crime scene and the discovery of a mysterious photo lead the police to think the killer is sending them clues, and further investigations uncover a secret the local community has been trying to hide.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. With three of the man's colleagues now suffering from psychological, drink or memory problems, the team considers whether he died as a result of the experiment, or if he was a victim of a cover-up by the Army.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A recently released convict comes under suspicion when a warden at his parole hostel is murdered. However, when the cold case squad become involved, it transpires the former prisoner may have been the intended target rather than the perpetrator, and that this killing may be connected to previous unsolved crimes. Nigel Terry and Kerry Fox guest star.

programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Jones.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the city of Arles, famous for its Roman architecture and the largest market in Provence. While there James sets up his mobile kitchen to cook a dish of John Dory with tomatoes, courgettes and clams - all from the stalls around him. He also has a go at pottery with a local ceramicist, visits an award-winning wine producer - who causes him to rethink the merits of rose wine - and heads to an olive grove where he cooks fried lamb chops with baby aubergines.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder tells the story of Frances Molloy, whose 18-year-old son was killed in a coach crash in 2012, leading her to fight for changes to the law, making it illegal for buses and coaches to use tyres that are more than 10 years old. He also examines the 1973 case of David McGreavy, who murdered three children he was supposed to be looking after.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which five frisbee players from London answer questions about top 10 lists, with the successful ones joining the team captain to score a perfect 10 in the final round in an attempt to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Tim, Sophie, Sarah and Rory pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona realises Marlon's anxiety is worse than she thought and alarm bells start ringing when Marlon reveals the extent of the pain he is experiencing to Paddy. Belle's face drops when she sees that Jamie and Andrea are back together, while Billy grills a defensive Cain on whether he's dealt with Malone, while a troubled Will watches their exchange from afar.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paddy and Marlon arrive at the hospital, but Paddy makes an enormous error, while Malone forces Billy to ask Cain to meet them at the scrapyard. Belle invites Ellis back to her place, desperate to put the memory of Jamie behind her.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Series of topical investigative reports exploring the stories behind the headlines.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Euston is evacuated during Friday rush hour - leaving passengers there and in Birmingham New Street station stranded, confused and angry. Driver Andy reveals just how close his train came to disaster on the tracks and train dispatcher and former bank manager David imparts his worldly wisdom to a new recruit on his first shift. A train runs a red signal at Birmingham, so engineers have to work through the night to move the stranded locomotive, investigate the cause and get things back up and running before the morning rush.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. This time, Security Officer Estefania investigates an oddly shaped object, and Passenger Experience Manager Harry deals with a medical emergency. Elsewhere, Border Force Bob helps a circus performer with visa troubles.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of Andrew and harassed by the journalists lurking outside her flat, Laura's world begins to turn in on her. When Winnie makes a surprising confession to her, together they follow a trail of evidence in the hope it will hold answers as to what is going through Carl's mind. But press interest and Katy's volatility threaten to derail Laura's progress. Will she learn what brought Carl and Andrew together, and the tumultuous consequences of that meeting? Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is challenged to find a classic endurance sports car, and a still-running Volvo PV544 seems to be the perfect example, but the engine proves difficult to master.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Tasmanian logging contractors the Bennett Brothers tackle forest tracks to move a huge tree winch. Elsewhere, a leaky fridge halts Woody's urgent frozen food delivery.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds an industrial-themed bike for Aaron Equipment Company, but Paul Teutul Sr becomes angry when a member of the team fails to turn up for a visit to the client.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: John thinks his '58 Corvette is 'mostly original', but Dan finds a mismatched assortment of poor quality parts. Meanwhile, Chelsea wants a rare 1971 Fury fixed up.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Queen Creek, Arizona, to press olives into oil, before cleaning dirty diapers in Sacramento.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Electric Stand-Up Vehicles/Frozen Fruit/Beer Coasters/Forged Door Handle
programme.desc: A look at how objects including electric stand-up vehicles, beer coasters and forged door handles are manufactured.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Investigating how rock crushers, fabric lampshades, cake sprinkles and steam irons are made.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Fulham, Brentford v West Bromwich Albion, and Stoke City v Middlesbrough.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: In a quiet south London suburb, Drew Pritchard comes face to face with the most extraordinary collection of American automobilia he's ever seen - including Evel Knievel's Messerschmitt.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Tasmanian logging contractors the Bennett Brothers tackle forest tracks to move a huge tree winch. Elsewhere, a leaky fridge halts Woody's urgent frozen food delivery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a a 1927 Rolls-Royce Phantom I Kenilworth and a 1930 Rolls-Royce Phantom I Newmarket.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia for the sale of a muscle car collection and is determined to buy the red Dino GTS he covets.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Bad weather strikes treasure hunter Darrell Miklos as he makes his way along the Columbus trail, forcing him to put his gear to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The beginning of the 2009 crab season finds the skippers on a high, but a rogue wave threatens to ruin everything.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The dangers of working under the ice start to become glaringly apparent to the fleet's greenhorns and veterans.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard heads to Petworth in West Sussex - the antiques capital of the south of England. He also bids on an unusual fire screen in Lancashire.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife truckers Nick and Jo recover a 70-year-old war plane. Elsewhere, a delayed flight to an outback town threatens to leave a mobile heart clinic without a doctor.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is challenged to find a classic endurance sports car, and a still-running Volvo PV544 seems to be the perfect example, but the engine proves difficult to master.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz return for a Double Dip, trying to pick what they couldn't the first time around.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets a Reading-based department store owner who drives a hard bargain, before he visits a country manor in West Sussex that contains an antique relating to Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria, whose assassination was one of a series of events that led to the First World War.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to tap into 1990s nostalgia by working on an 1994 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4, but restoring the vehicle to its original state proves harder than expected.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Tom asks Dan to find him a rare 1967 Camaro Convertible with factory air conditioning. However, when Dan finds the Unicorn, the car is too good to cut up.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating seemingly simple modern-day objects. This time, how rowing machines, Parma ham and London Underground signs are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do planes take off and land on a beach at one of the world's oldest airports? And, how do they hand-make the national dress of Bavaria, lederhosen?.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Report on the trial and conviction of New York Mafia boss Vincent Gigante, nicknamed the Oddfather, who was accused of ordering the deaths of seven gangsters and plotting to kill others as revenge for unsanctioned Mob murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. Later, a renowned fire inspector checked the evidence and discovered the real culprit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A cold case from 1957, in which a man committed several crimes in one night - including murder. California police followed numerous leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators made a breakthrough.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Diane Cunningham is found murdered, the only clues are several receipts. Security footage reveals a prime suspect, but not everything is quite as it seems.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A murder witness is killed shortly after testifying in court, and the Puerto Rico governor suspects it is the work of corrupt police officers.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Tempers fray as Mark meets aggressive dogs and home-owners to educate them about a new law making it illegal to keep a dog on a chain when temperatures hit over 100 degrees.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim has his hands full with some lively little Tasmanian Devils, Chris meets a pug with an overly long tongue and Lisa fears for a ragdoll cat's weak legs.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jessica has fallen head-over-heels for a dress outside of her budget, but will she be willing to compromise?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A lesbian couple want very different looks for their wedding, while a wedding planner is determined that her bride has a perfect fitting.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A cockatiel is brought in with a broken leg, and Chris Brown carries out a radical treatment involving a pencil, pilates and sticky tape.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown looks after a greyhound that has been dumped after it failed to prove its worth on the racing track.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown helps a cuckoo with an injured leg, rescues two dogs from a rooftop, examines a golden retriever, and checks a koala's eyesight.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a racehorse to see if it can join the unwanted thoroughbred programme. Plus, a dog hit by a car, and a kitten with earache receive attention.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A young otter, Monty, has trouble chewing his food after a potential tooth infection. Plus, the keepers share how they care for the zoo's three female elephants.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry from Cashbrokers in Penzance goes to look at some antique petrol pumps, while in south-east London childhood sweethearts want to pawn their jewellery to fund a family reunion.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old Jessica Heeringa, who vanished from her job as an overnight petrol station attendant in April 2013. All leads in the case eventually went cold.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case involving an artist who vanished on her way home from work. When her car was found abandoned in a car park, it set off a dark speculation about her disappearance.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The stabbing of Arkansas cheerleader Julie Heath in October 1993. Eric Nance raped and murdered the 18-year-old, and 12 years later was put to death for the crime.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A consultant meets 18-year-old bride Kelsey, who arrives with plenty of drama over a broken promise about who would be her maid of honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Michael and Chris have different visions for their wedding and tension soon rises between the pair as Lori tries to find some common ground.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Heather's fiance acts like a drill sergeant when picking out dresses and the bride soon becomes frustrated with his bad attitude.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman's brash mother causes her bridesmaids to feel self-conscious in their dresses, giving consultant Nikky a lot of work to do.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Cassie tries to build bridges between her two best friends, who have hated each other since the day they met.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Amber and Ajeshia struggle to reach a compromise on the necklines of their bridesmaid dresses.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Stockport, Greater Manchester, Sarah Moore sets about transforming a beaten-up chest of drawers, a sack barrow and some copper pipes. Thanks to the help of furniture designer Zoe and metal worker Bex Simon, Sarah later has money to hand over for all of her finds, but just how much cash was there to be made from the Stockport trash?.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Nathan and Debb test-drive an unusual motorcycle simulator at Pickwick Pawnbrokers, while Larry and Neil look to complete deals involving a rare drum kit, a luxury set of travel bags and an antique medicine cabinet at Cashbrokers in Penzance.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Olivia is battling depression and has not left her basement in more than two years owing to her weight issues. She travels to Houston in the hope of having life-changing surgery.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A psychological profile of Douglas Perry, who had a sex change operation after killing three women in 1990 and was only caught 22 years later.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: Twenty eight-year-old Mahmuda Khatun stabbed her husband of only one month on his birthday. It was Khatun's second marriage arranged by her family and her defence lawyer suggested the stabbing arose out of cultural tensions. Here, detectives, experts and acquaintances discuss why they believe the optician's shop assistant murdered him.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.
